verbose_text: Strikingly, the inactivation of E2F6 in checkpoint compromised cells (siE2F6 siChk1) can drive chromatin recruitment of FANCD2 and Rad51 (XREF_FIG D), correlating with the reduction in RS induced DNA damage levels seen (XREF_FIG B and XREF_SUPPLEMENTARY C).
evidence: E2F6 in checkpoint-compromised cells (siE2F6 siChk1) can drive chromatin recruitment of FANCD2 and Rad51 ( XREF_FIG D), correlating with the reduction in RS-induced DNA damage
